current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act and the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 to
			 increase the number of children eligible for free school meals, with a
			 phased-in transition period, with an offset.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Expand School Meals Act of 2014

header.#text: Denial of deduction for punitive damages

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Internal Revenue Code of 1986/s:162/ss:g
Internal Revenue Code of 1986/s:162/ss:g/p:1
Internal Revenue Code of 1986/s:162/ss:g/p:2
Internal Revenue Code of 1986/s:162/ss:g/p:1/sp:A
Internal Revenue Code of 1986/s:162/ss:g/p:1/sp:B

text.#text:
by adding at the end the following new
			 paragraph:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Internal Revenue Code of 1986/s:104/ss:c

text.#text:
No deduction shall be allowed under this
				chapter for any amount paid or incurred for punitive damages in
			 connection with
				any judgment in, or settlement of, any action. This paragraph shall
			 not apply
				to punitive damages described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Internal Revenue Code of 1986/s:162/ss:g

header.#text:
Inclusion in Income of Punitive Damages
			 Paid by Insurer or Otherwise

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 amended by adding at the end the following new section:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Part II of subchapter B of

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Internal Revenue Code of 1986/ch:1/sch:B/pt:II

text.#text:
Gross income
				shall include any amount paid to or on behalf of a taxpayer as
			 insurance or
				otherwise by reason of the taxpayer’s liability (or agreement) to
			 pay punitive
				damages.

header.#text:
Punitive damages compensated by insurance
				or otherwise

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the
			 end the following new subsection:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Internal Revenue Code of 1986/s:6041

text.#text:
This section
				shall apply to payments by a person to or on behalf of any
			 corporation, individual, partnership, or other entity, as
				insurance or otherwise, by reason of such corporation,
			 individual, partnership, or entity’s liability (or agreement)
				to pay punitive
				damages.

header.#text:
Section To Apply to Punitive Damages
				Compensation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the
			 following new
			 item:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
part II of
			 subchapter B of chapter 1 of such Code
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Internal Revenue Code of 1986/ch:1/sch:B/pt:II

toc-entry.#text:
Sec. 91. Punitive damages
				compensated by insurance or
				otherwise.

text.#text:
The amendments made by
			 this section shall apply to damages paid or incurred on or after the date
			 of
			 the enactment of this Act.
